intro: Centaurea pospichalii, commonly known as the Pospichal's cornflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its bright blue to violet flowers bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Centaurea pospichalii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas.
